name.description: The name used in the URL, usually the plural

slug.description: The slug according to the config slugification strategy

paginate_by.description: If this is set, the list of individual taxonomy term page will be paginated by this much

paginate_path.description: If this is set, the list of individual taxonomy term page will be paginated by this much

render.description: Whether the taxonomy will be rendered, defaults to `true`

feed.description: Whether to generate a feed only for each taxonomy term, defaults to `false`

include_title.description: Whether to include the title of the page/section in the index

include_description.description: Whether to include the description of the page/section in the index

include_date.description: Whether to include the RFC3339 datetime of the page in the search index

include_path.description: Whether to include the path of the page/section in the index (the permalink is always included)

include_content.description: Whether to include the rendered content of the page/section in the index

index_format.description: Whether to produce the search index as a javascript file or as a JSON file

truncate_content_length.description: Optionally truncate the content down to `n` code points. This might cut content in a word

Translations.description:
Optional translation object for the default language
Example:```default_language = "fr"

[translations]

title = "Un titre"```

base_url.description: The base URL of the site; the only required configuration variable.

title.description: The site title; used in feeds by default.

description.description: The site description; used in feeds by default.

default_language.description: The default language; used in feeds.

output_dir.description: For overriding the default output directory `public`, set it to another value (e.g.: "docs")

preserve_dotfiles_in_output.description:
Whether dotfiles at the root level of the output directory are preserved when (re)building the site. 
Enabling this also prevents the deletion of the output folder itself on rebuilds.

compile_sass.description:
When set to "true", the Sass files in the `sass` directory in the site root are compiled. 
Sass files in theme directories are always compiled.

minify_html.description: When set to "true", the generated HTML files are minified.

ignored_content.description:
A list of glob patterns specifying asset files to ignore when the content
directory is processed. Defaults to none, which means that all asset files are
copied over to the `public` directory.
Example:
ignored_content = ["*.{graphml,xlsx}", "temp.*", "**/build_folder"]

ignored_static.description: Similar to ignored_content, a list of glob patterns specifying asset files to ignore when the static directory is processed. Defaults to none, which means that all asset files are copied over to the `public` directory

generate_feeds.description: When set to "true", a feed is automatically generated.

exclude_paginated_pages_in_sitemap.default: When set to "all", paginated pages are not a part of the sitemap, default is "none"

feed_filenames.description:
The filenames to use for the feeds. Used as the template filenames, too.
Defaults to ["atom.xml"], which has a built-in template that renders an Atom 1.0 feed.
There is also a built-in template "rss.xml" that renders an RSS 2.0 feed.

feed_limit.description: The number of articles to include in the feed. All items are included if this limit is not set (the default).

hard_link_static.description: When set to "true", files in the `static` directory are hard-linked. Useful for large static files. Note that for this to work, both `static` and the output directory need to be on the same filesystem. Note that the theme's `static` files are always copied, regardless of this setting.

taxonomies.description: The taxonomies to be rendered for the site and their configuration of the default languages

build_search_index.description: When set to "true", a search index is built from the pages and section content for `default_language`.

generate_sitemap.description: When set to "false", Sitemap.xml is not generated

generate_robots_txt.description: hen set to "false", robots.txt is not generated

highlight_code.description: When set to "true", all code blocks are highlighted.

error_on_missing_highlight.description: When set to "true", missing highlight languages are treated as errors. Defaults to false.

extra_syntaxes_and_themes.description: When set to "true", missing highlight languages are treated as errors. Defaults to false.

highlight_theme.description: The theme to use for code highlighting.

items.description: Generate CSS files for Themes out of syntect

render_emoji.description: # When set to "true", emoji aliases translated to their corresponding Unicode emoji equivalent in the rendered Markdown files. (e.g.: :smile: => ðŸ˜„)

external_links_class.description: CSS class to add to external links (e.g. "external-link")

external_links_target_blank.description:
Whether external links are to be opened in a new tab
If this is true, a `rel="noopener"` will always automatically be added for security reasons

external_links_no_follow.description: Whether to set rel="nofollow" for all external links

external_links_no_referrer.description: Whether to set rel="noreferrer" for all external links

smart_punctuation.description:
Whether smart punctuation is enabled (changing quotes, dashes, dots in their typographic form)
For example, `...` into `â€¦`, `"quote"` into `â€œcurlyâ€` etc

definition_list.description: Whether parsing of definition lists is enabled

lazy_async_image.description:
Whether to set decoding="async" and loading="lazy" for all images
When turned on, the alt text must be plain text.
For example, `![xx](...)` is ok but `![*x*x](...)` isnâ€™t ok

bottom_footnotes.description: Whether footnotes are rendered in the GitHub-style (at the bottom, with back references) or plain (in the place, where they are defined)

insert_anchor_links.description:
This determines whether to insert a link for each header like the ones you can see on this site if you hover over a header.
The default template can be overridden by creating an `anchor-link.html` file in the `templates` directory.
This value can be "left", "right", "heading" or "none".
"heading" means the full heading becomes the text of the anchor.
See "Internal links & deep linking" in the documentation for more information.

skip_prefixes.description: Skip link checking for external URLs that start with these prefixes

skip_anchor_prefixes.description: Skip anchor checking for external URLs that start with these prefixes

internal_level.description: Treat internal link problems as either "error" or "warn", default is "error"

external_level.description: Treat external link problems as either "error" or "warn", default is "error"

ignore_files.description: A list of file glob patterns to skip link checking on

paths_keep_dates.description:
Whether to remove date prefixes for page path slugs.
For example, content/posts/2016-10-08_a-post-with-dates.md => posts/a-post-with-dates
When true, content/posts/2016-10-08_a-post-with-dates.md => posts/2016-10-08-a-post-with-dates

title.description: The site title; used in feeds by default.

description.description: The site description; used in feeds by default.

The filenames to use for the feeds. Used as the template filenames, too.
Defaults to ["atom.xml"], which has a built-in template that renders an Atom 1.0 feed.
There is also a built-in template "rss.xml" that renders an RSS 2.0 feed.
